alert.note: Alert for Todd (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 10:09PM CDT until April 18 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Long Prairie River at Long Prairie affecting Todd County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Long Prairie River at Long Prairie. * WHEN...Until Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, 1st Avenue SW becomes innundated. Lumber yard and produce store parking lots flood due to water backing up Venewitz Creek. Lions Westside park impacted. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 915 PM CDT Friday, the stage was 7.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 915 PM CDT Friday was 7.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Monday afternoon and continue falling to 6.3 feet next Friday evening. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.3 feet on 03/28/2019. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
